content.thinking: Let me analyze this Colombian "Final Beneficiaries Report" (Reporte de Beneficiarios Finales) issued by DIAN to extract the required information. Número de identificación": "8001882949" - IdentificationType: For DIAN reports, this is "NIT" From page 2, I can see the beneficiaries data: First beneficiary: - Document type: "1" and "3" (this seems to match between cells 29 and the repeated section) - ID Number: "19255765" (from cell 30 "Número de identificación") - This should match cell 32 "Número de Identificación Tributaria - NIT": "19255765" ✓ - First name: From cells "36. Primer nombre" and "37. Otros nombres": "JUAN" and "CLAUDIO" - Last name: From cells "34. Primer apellido" and "35. Segundo apellido": "SANCHEZ" and "FERRE" - Participation percentage: From cell "57. Porcentaje de participación": "49.6" - Novelty type: From cell "61. Tipo de novedad": "Actualización" (code 2) Second beneficiary: - ID Number: "41324009" (from cell 30) - This should match cell 32: "41324009" ✓ - First name: "MARTHA" and "PATRICIA" - Last name: "SANCHEZ" and "FERRE" - Participation percentage: "40.22" - Novelty type: "Actualización" (code 2) I notice the total participation percentage is 89.82%, which falls short of 100%. This discrepancy requires careful examination, though the individual percentages are clearly documented. Both beneficiaries' identification type is confirmed as "NIT" based on the DIAN report's standard documentation.
